fields.description: When testing the ability to authorize multiple ports on a single group with one API call (as the API supports), I discovered that the CLC doesn't support the newer call parameters. Euca2ools calls a deprecated method in boto to still use the old scheme. Here's an example of what happens when trying the new set of parameters: ERROR:boto:412 Precondition Failed ERROR:boto:412 Precondition FailedFailed to bind the following fields: IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol = tcp IpPermissions.1.ToPort = 22 IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp = 10.0.0.0/24 IpPermissions.1.FromPort = 22 Failed to bind the following fields: IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol = tcp IpPermissions.1.ToPort = 22 IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp = 10.0.0.0/24 IpPermissions.1.FromPort = 22 WARNING:root:412 GET /ec2?Action=AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress&GroupName=test_grp&IpPermissions.1.ToPort=22&IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol=tcp&IpPermissions.1.FromPort=22&IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp=10.0.0.0%2F24 (::1) 115.06ms
fields.summary: AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress doesn't support newer parameter scheme

comments.body: I have an EC2 api document that shows the newer scheme as of version 2010-06-15.
Looking at the API doc archives at Amazon, this version seems to be where the parameter scheme was introduced: http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-11-30/APIReference/

For reference:

API Doc when change was implemented:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-11-30/APIReference/ApiReference-query-AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress.html

API Doc before change (the API call which Eucalyptus uses):
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-10-31/APIReference/ApiReference-query-AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress.html

This also breaks the Amazon AWS PHP SDK as the SDK does not support the old way any longer.
Note that this blocks AWS Java SDK support, too.

Reproduced with 3.2.0 using boto: {noformat} header: Content-Length: 129 header: Content-Type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8 send: 'POST /services/Eucalyptus/ HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: 192.168.111.10:8773\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nContent-Length: 394\r\nContent-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8\r\nUser-Agent: Boto/2.6.0 (darwin)\r\n\r\nAWSAccessKeyId=ZOAHNWLW93VNHIX61D29F&Action=AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress&GroupName=appscalecgb138&IpPermissions.1.FromPort=1&IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol=udp&IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp=0.0.0.0%2F0&IpPermissions.1.ToPort=65535&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-02-04T21%3A36%3A11Z&Version=2010-08-31&Signature=URfHztxMRmDZDusGBF4vAUcjXODP%2B2%2FTo34l%2FLn2eHk%3D' reply: 'HTTP/1.1 412 Precondition Failed\r\n' header: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/appscale", line 46, in appscale.up() File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/../lib/appscale.py", line 230, in up AppScaleTools.run_instances(options) File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/../lib/appscale_tools.py", line 70, in run_instances public_ip, instance_id = RemoteHelper.start_head_node(options, node_layout) File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/../lib/remote_helper.py", line 79, in start_head_node instance_id, public_ip, private_ip = cls.spawn_node_in_cloud(options) File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/../lib/remote_helper.py", line 139, in spawn_node_in_cloud agent.configure_instance_security(params) File "/Users/cgb/appscale-tools/bin/../lib/agents/ec2_agent.py", line 116, in configure_instance_security to_port=65535, ip_protocol='udp', cidr_ip='0.0.0.0/0') File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/boto-2.6.0-py2.7.egg/boto/ec2/connection.py", line 2399, in authorize_security_group params, verb='POST') File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/boto-2.6.0-py2.7.egg/boto/connection.py", line 1019, in get_status raise self.ResponseError(response.status, response.reason, body) boto.exception.EC2ResponseError: EC2ResponseError: 412 Precondition Failed 412 Precondition FailedFailed to bind the following fields: IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol = udp IpPermissions.1.ToPort = 65535 IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp = 0.0.0.0/0 IpPermissions.1.FromPort = 1 Failed to bind the following fields: IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol = udp IpPermissions.1.ToPort = 65535 IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp = 0.0.0.0/0 IpPermissions.1.FromPort = 1 {noformat}

Hi All,

Using euca2ools 3.0.0-alpha4-14-g150208c (Sparta) against eucalyptus 3.3.0 commit ID 058b8949d73395ede657a848086bd6e27477510c , trying following command 

{code}
$ euca-authorize -P tcp -p 22 -s 0.0.0.0/0 default
{code}

Get the following error

{code}
euca-authorize: error (400 Bad Request): Failed to bind the following fields:
IpPermissions.1.IpProtocol = tcp
IpPermissions.1.ToPort = 22
IpPermissions.1.IpRanges.1.CidrIp = 0.0.0.0/0
IpPermissions.1.FromPort = 22
{code}

Hope we fix this one soon! 

Cheers!
Deependra
Bumping severity, as this breaks euca2ools 3
Making this a 3.3.0 priority based on the number of tools running into the issue.  Thanks [~dshekhawat] for pointing it out!

AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress and RevokeSecurityGroupIngress now support the more recent API versions (some of which support security group identifiers)

The implementation of this fix maintains support for euca2ools 2.x and adds support for euca2ools 3.x.
I want to verify (and I should have asked sooner), that the old parameter scheme is no longer supported?
The older parameter scheme is supported, but you have to pass an appropriate API version.
user console now uses newer scheme.
